current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit the implementation of any program that grants
		  temporary legal status to, or adjusts the status of, any individual who is
		  unlawfully present in the United States until the Secretary of Homeland
		  Security certifies that the US–VISIT system has been fully implemented at every
		  land, sea, and air port of entry.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following bill;
			 which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that the
			 integrated entry and exit data system required under

text.#text:
Any program that authorizes granting
			 temporary legal status to individuals who are unlawfully present in the United
			 States or adjusting the status of such individuals to that of aliens lawfully
			 admitted for permanent residence may not be implemented until the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 which was required to be implemented by December 21, 2005, has been fully
			 implemented and is functioning at every land, sea, and air port of
			 entry.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 110 of the Illegal
			 Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996/s:110
